fields_of_interest: Education and training, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society
head_office_address: Payton House, Packwood Court Guild Street
eu_initiatives: FutureTrust, LightEST, European Trust Foundation, FutureID, Stork 2.0, SSEDIC
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
EEMA has a significant role in the following projects 
 
FutureTrust 
Against the background of the regulation 2014/910/EU on electronic identification (eID) and trusted services for electronic transactions in the internal market (eIDAS), the FutureTrust project aims at supporting the practical implementation of the regulation in Europe and beyond.  
 
LIGHTest 
The objective of LIGHTest is to create a global cross-domain trust infrastructure that renders it transparent and easy for verifiers to evaluate electronic transactions. By querying different trust authorities world-wide and combining trust aspects related to identity, business, reputation etc. it will become possible to conduct domain-specific trust decisions. 
 
European Trust Foundation 
A strong Europe-wide independent body for promoting Digital Trust made up of an active body of experts who can contribute to European Projects with a unified European voice
goals__remit:
EEMA is the leading independent European Think Tank focusing on identification, authentication, privacy, risk management, cyber security, the Internet of Things and mobile applications.   
 
EEMA’s world class conferences provide the forum to network with digital enterprise professionals high level EC and other government experts. Our conferences, together with our series of High Level Fireside Briefings in Brussels and London, provides the ideal setting for industry leaders to tackle controversial hot topics in an intimate, informative and invitation only setting. 
 
EEMA collaborates with EU & Global Partners, has an established and growing network throughout Europe and provides the ideal platform to disseminate information and share expertise regarding the high-profile and significant EU projects. 
 
•    EEMA is an established EU Project Partner for dissemination throughout Europe 
 
•    EEMA educates and informs our network of members of latest developments, technologies and innovations in an independent environment. 
 
•    EEMA identifies expertise and knowledge in every area and can be the enabler for members to meet the most appropriate person to discuss and resolve issues and challenges. 
 
EEMA also organises Information Security Solutions Europe (ISSE), Europe's only independent security conference and exhibition.
